channel.title: DjMonkey's Games and Tools
channel.description: Recent content on DjMonkey's Games and Tools

item.title: No Man's Sky - Base Building App üöÄ
item.description:
Created in 2022, the No Man’s Sky Base Building App is a standalone application, introducing a more user friendly way of building bases outside of the game compared to the previous Blender method. It allows the ability to import/export bases to the game, create prefab collections of parts, and free placement of parts.

[ NEXUS MODS ]

holy moly - Sean Murray

item.title: No Man's Sky - Base Building for Blender üèóÔ∏è
item.description:
Created in 2019, the No Man’s Sky Base Building Blender Addon is a add-on extension for Blender 3.0+, introducing a way to create and edit No Man’s Sky bases within the 3D application. It allowed players to push their creativity to the limits and is still being used by a community of base builders today.

[ NEXUS MODS | GITHUB]

item.title: Tales from The Dancing Moon üíÉüèªüåô
item.description:
Tales from the Dancing Moon is a life-sim RPG set in a parallel universe inspired by UK culture and fantasy novels. After the events of a shadow-beast invasion on a seaside town, complete villager quests and collect hidden diaries to understand your role in this mysterious character-driven story.

[ STEAM | PRESS-KIT | PRIVACY POLICY ]

Gameplay

Tales from the Dancing Moon is a casual RPG set in √èllisor ‚Äì a fantasy seaside village recovering from a recent invasion of shadow-beasts. You are a newcomer, unsure of what has happened and why you ended up here.

item.title: Tales from The Dancing Moon Press Kit
item.description:
Description

Tales from the Dancing Moon is a life-sim RPG set in a parallel universe inspired by UK culture and fantasy novels. After the events of a shadow-beast invasion on a seaside town, complete villager quests and collect hidden diaries to understand your role in this mysterious character-driven story.

History

The idea of Tales from The Dancing Moon formed back in 2012 after I left University and has been in my head ever since. It‚Äôs story is inspired by ‚Äúportal-story‚Äù adventures, such as Narnia or Alice in Wonderland.
